item.title: Filled Artichoke
item.description:
Step 0: Ingredients

  1. 4 artichokes (the leaves on, duh!)
  2. 4 cloves of garlic
  3. 2 lemons
  4. A handful of chopped dill
  5. 1 cup of your favorite kind of rice
  6. 1 white onion
  7. Half tablespoon red pepper paste
  8. Half tablespoon tomato paste
  9. 2 tablespoon olive oil
  10. Salt, pepper, thyme or oregano, cumin.

Step 1: Simmering

Boil water, add a juice of a lemon and simmer artichokes lid on in this mix for 30 minutes.


When you take the artichokes out do not forget to wash them with cold water so that you do not burn your hands.

Step 2: Cleaning

Using a spoon, we cut the centerpiece of the artichoke. . Carve this area with your spoon.


The center has baby leaves that are more like spikes or thorn.


Be careful do not put a whole there.

Step 3: Preparing Filling

In a bowl, mix rice, chopped onion, dill (save some for dressing), spices, the pastes, and olive oil. This is where you can be creative. If you are an omnivore you can add ground meat.

Step 4: Filling the Artichoke

Fill the inside of each leave and the heart of the artichoke with the filling. But a clove of garlic and lemon ring on top of the heart. Add (prefarebly boiling) water and a juice of a half lemon to the bowl, stir it well. Pour this water/lemon juice/paste broth on top of each artichoke.


You can add more tomato paste to the broth.

Step 5: Cooking

Put them on high heat when the broth starts boiling turn it on low and simmer it for 20 minutes. If the rice is soft, they should be ready.

Step 6: Serving

Serve with yogurt and extra plate for the leave wastes. Use leaves as spoons to eat the filling. Use your lower teeth to bite off the meaty part of each leaves.
